summary: The International Finance Corporation (IFC) is a member of the World Bank Group, primarily focused on promoting private sector investment in developing countries. Within the context of EU legal and regulatory frameworks, the IFC plays a pivotal role in enhancing sustainable economic growth and reducing poverty through investment and advisory services. The EU collaborates with the IFC to align development financing with its own strategic objectives, particularly in areas such as climate change and sustainable development. This partnership underscores the importance of international cooperation in achieving regulatory compliance and fostering economic resilience in emerging markets.
